Adds the AggressiveWhenSeeTarget component onto the object with the given data.

AddMeleeAttack<T>(GameObject, CreatureComponents, GameObject, bool, float, float, bool)

Assigns the essential fields of any sort of MeleeAttack component. For anything else, you're on your own.

public static T AddMeleeAttack<T>(GameObject creature, CreatureComponents components, GameObject mouth, bool automaticallyAddOnTouchCallback, float damage, float interval = 1, bool canBiteVehicle = true) where T : MeleeAttack

Parameters

creature GameObject

The creature prefab root.

components CreatureComponents

Components reference object.

mouth GameObject

The object that has the bite trigger.

automaticallyAddOnTouchCallback bool

If true, the OnTouch component will be added and properly assigned.

damage float

Bite damage.

interval float

Seconds between each bite.

canBiteVehicle bool

If false, this creature is unable to attack the Seamoth and PRAWN Suit.

Returns

T

Type Parameters

T

Type which must be the same as or inherit from MeleeAttack.

AddOnTouchTrigger(GameObject, GameObject, string, string)

Adds an instance of the OnTouch component onto triggerObject that calls the method as defined by the parameters.

public static OnTouch AddOnTouchTrigger(GameObject triggerObject, GameObject callbackObject, string callbackComponentTypeName, string callbackMethodName)

Parameters

triggerObject GameObject

The object that holds the touch trigger, for example a creature's mouth collider. Must have Collider with UnityEngine.Collider.isTrigger set to TRUE.

callbackObject GameObject

The GameObject that holds the callback component and method.

callbackComponentTypeName string

The name of the type that holds the action performed when the object is collided with.

callbackMethodName string

The name of the method that is performed when the object is collided with.

Returns

OnTouch

AddVFXFabricating(GameObject, VFXFabricatingData)

Adds the VFXFabricating component onto a prefab to enable its model in the Fabricator. Automatically determines settings if data is null.

public static VFXFabricating AddVFXFabricating(GameObject creature, VFXFabricatingData data)

Parameters

creature GameObject
data VFXFabricatingData

Returns

VFXFabricating

CreateTrailManagerManually(GameObject, BehaviourLOD, Transform, Transform[], float, float)

Creates a TrailManager, which controls the procedural animations of tail-like objects.

[Obsolete("See ECCLibrary.Data.TrailManagerBuilder instead.")]
public static TrailManager CreateTrailManagerManually(GameObject trailRoot, BehaviourLOD behaviourLOD, Transform creatureRoot, Transform[] trails, float segmentSnapSpeed, float maxSegmentOffset = -1)

Parameters

trailRoot GameObject

The root of the spine and object that the TrailManager is added to.

behaviourLOD BehaviourLOD

The BehaviourLOD of this creature.

creatureRoot Transform

The creature's uppermost Transform.

trails Transform[]

Any objects that are simulated. Should NOT include the trailRoot's transform.

segmentSnapSpeed float

How fast each segment snaps back into the default position. A higher value gives a more rigid appearance.

maxSegmentOffset float

How far each segment can be from the original position.

Returns

TrailManager

CreateTrailManagerManually(GameObject, CreatureComponents, Transform[], float, float)

Creates a TrailManager, which controls the procedural animations of tail-like objects.

[Obsolete("See ECCLibrary.Data.TrailManagerBuilder instead.")]
public static TrailManager CreateTrailManagerManually(GameObject trailRoot, CreatureComponents components, Transform[] trails, float segmentSnapSpeed, float maxSegmentOffset = -1)

Parameters

trailRoot GameObject

The root of the spine and object that the TrailManager is added to.

components CreatureComponents

The CreatureComponents of this creature.

trails Transform[]

Any objects that are simulated. Should NOT include the trailRoot's transform.

segmentSnapSpeed float

How fast each segment snaps back into the default position. A higher value gives a more rigid appearance.

maxSegmentOffset float

How far each segment can be from the original position.

Returns

TrailManager

CreateTrailManagerWithAllChildren(GameObject, BehaviourLOD, Transform, float, float, float)

Creates a TrailManager, which controls the procedural animations of tail-like objects.

[Obsolete("See ECCLibrary.Data.TrailManagerBuilder instead.")]
public static TrailManager CreateTrailManagerWithAllChildren(GameObject trailParent, BehaviourLOD behaviourLOD, Transform creatureRoot, float segmentSnapSpeed, float maxSegmentOffset = -1, float multiplier = 1)

Parameters

trailParent GameObject

The root of the spine and object that the TrailManager is added to. The first child of this object and all children of the first child are used for the trail.

behaviourLOD BehaviourLOD

The BehaviourLOD of this creature.

creatureRoot Transform

The creature's uppermost Transform.

segmentSnapSpeed float

How fast each segment snaps back into the default position. A higher value gives a more rigid appearance.

maxSegmentOffset float

How far each segment can be from the original position.

multiplier float

The total strength of the movement. A value too low or too high will break the trail completely.

Returns

TrailManager

CreateTrailManagerWithAllChildren(GameObject, CreatureComponents, float, float, float)

Creates a TrailManager, which controls the procedural animations of tail-like objects.

[Obsolete("See ECCLibrary.Data.TrailManagerBuilder instead.")]
public static TrailManager CreateTrailManagerWithAllChildren(GameObject trailParent, CreatureComponents components, float segmentSnapSpeed, float maxSegmentOffset = -1, float multiplier = 1)

Parameters

trailParent GameObject

The root of the spine and object that the TrailManager is added to. The first child of this object and all children of the first child are used for the trail.

components CreatureComponents

The CreatureComponents of this creature.

segmentSnapSpeed float

How fast each segment snaps back into the default position. A higher value gives a more rigid appearance.

maxSegmentOffset float

How far each segment can be from the original position.

multiplier float

The total strength of the movement. A value too low or too high will break the trail completely.

Returns

TrailManager

MakeObjectScannerRoomScannable(GameObject, bool)

Makes a given GameObject scannable with the scanner room, using the ResourceTracker component.

public static void MakeObjectScannerRoomScannable(GameObject gameObject, bool updatePositionPeriodically)

Parameters

gameObject GameObject
updatePositionPeriodically bool

Whether to automatically update the position of this ResourceTracker or not (should always be true for creatures).
